content:
- 8 -
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
In all instances where it is possible to do so, recently isolated strains of the various Shigella serotypes will be selected for distribution to National Shigella Centres. These cultures will be chosen from materials available at both the International Shigella Centres, and the selected standard or type cultures will be studied in both the Centres and then dried (lyophilized) in large lots by the National Collection of Type Cultures, London, for both 1 Centres. The dried standard Shigella serotypes will then be made available to the two Centres, for re-examination and subsequent distribution to National Shigella Centres in various countries. Future supplies of antisera, referred to in the paragraph below, will be prepared with these standard cultures. The standard cultures may be changed from time to time if replacement of certain strains is warranted because of variational changes or development of roughness.
Each of the International Shigella Centres will prepare and supply unabsorbed antisera for the more common Shigella serotypes to National Shigella Centres. The antisera will be accompanied by dried cultures of the homologous Shigella serotypes, together with any additional strains that may be required for proper absorption of certain antisera. A list of the 13 individual anti- sera to be supplied to National Shigella Centres is given in table III (see page 13). 140.112.213.82
If any National Shigella Centre should wish to expand its programme and activities so as to include identification of additional Shigella serotypes the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, would be willing to prepare and supply the required antisera. Dried cultures to accompany such antisera would be prepared, in the manner mentioned above, by the National Collection of Type Cultures.
1 The National Collection of Type Cultures, London, may be regarded as one of the three component units of the National Shigella Centre of the United Kingdom, the other two being the Standards Laboratory for Serological Reagents and the Dysentery Reference Laboratory. The structure of this Centre is therefore analogous to that of the United Kingdom National Salmonella Centre as described on page 17.
國史饭 Academia Historica
80

衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
In all instances where it is possible to do so, recently isolated strains
of the various Shigella serotypes will be selected for distribution to National
Shigella Centres. These cultures will be chosen from materials available at
both the International Shigella Centres, and the selected standard or type
cultures will be studied in both the Centres and then dried (lyophilized) in
large lots by the National Collection of Type Cultures, London, for both
Centres. The dried standard Shigella serotypes will then be made available
to the two Centres, for re-examination and subsequent distribution to National
Shigella Centres in various countries. Future supplies of antisera, referred
to in the paragraph below, will be prepared with these standard cultures. The
standard cultures may be changed from time to time if replacement of certain
strains is warranted because of variational changes or development of roughness.
Each of the International Shigella Centres will prepare and supply
unabsorbed antisera for the more common Shigella serotypes to National Shigella
Centres. The antisera will be accompanied by dried cultures of the homologous
Shigella serotypes, together with any additional strains that may be required
for proper absorption of certain antisera. A list of the 13 individual anti-
sera to be supplied to National Shigella Centres is given in table III (see
page 13).
If any National Shigella Centre should wish to expand its programme
and activities so as to include identification of additional Shigella serotypes
the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, would be willing to prepare and
supply the required antisera. Dried cultures to accompany such antisera would

Type Cultures.
The National Collection of Type Cultures, London, may be regarded as one of the

Laboratory. The structure of this Centre is therefore analogous to that of the
United Kingdom National Salmonella Centre as described on page 17.

Academia Historica

In all instances where it is possible to do so, recently isolated strains of the various Shigella serotypes will be selected for distribution to National Shigella Centres. These cultures will be chosen from materials available at both the International Shigella Centres, and the selected standard or type cultures will be studied in both the Centres and then dried (lyophilized) in large lots by the National Collection of Type Cultures, London, for both 1 Centres. Each of the International Shigella Centres will prepare and supply unabsorbed antisera for the more common Shigella serotypes to National Shigella Centres.
